messageBody:
yosefshariat wrote:
> I expect to see an assertion but I see following error:
> java.lang.Exception: Unexpected exception,
> expected<java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException> but
> was<java.lang.AssertionError>â€¦.
>

The 'expected' construct isn't to tell JUnit the exception
MAY be thrown, but that the code being tested MUST throw
the expected exception.

I added a few more test cases:

public class TestAssertAndException {
@Test(expected = ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.class)
public void testWithBoth()
{
String s[] = new String[]{"1"};
Assert.assertTrue(false);
System.out.println(s[10]);
}

@Test(expected = ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.class)
public void testWithExpected()
{
String s[] = new String[]{"1"};
Assert.assertTrue(true);
System.out.println(s[10]);
}

@Test(expected = ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.class)
public void testWithNeither()
{
String s[] = new String[]{"1"};
Assert.assertTrue(true);
System.out.println(s[0]);
}

The only one that passes is testWithExpected.

The testWithNeither fails (because no exception was thrown) with:

java.lang.AssertionError: Expected exception:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

Richard.
